title: Listening Comprehension Demo
instruction:
The purpose of this test is to demonstrate the realisation of the computer-based listening comprehension test as it will be arranged spring 2017. Its parts do not form a solid listening comprehension test but instead are a collection of separate individual listening comprehension parts. The function of the buttons and video is what can be expected in spring 2017.

You may start the audio recordings and the video pertaining to the questions of the listening comprehension test at your own pace, by clicking the corresponding buttons. You are free to decide yourself how much time you spend on reading the questions and answering them. When you have clicked on a button to play a certain audio recording, you can no longer listen to that particular recording again. Do not begin listening before you are ready.<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="attachments/index_files/custom.css" />

questions.text: Tom Bentley You will be able to hear each part twice: first straight through, then in short sections. Answer questions 1.1-1.10. When you have listened to a recording, you will no longer be able to listen to it again. Used buttons become grey.

restrictedMedia.text: First, listen to the part straight through.

options.text: Head of a multinational corporation
Some kind of politician
A family friend of Tony Blair

choices.text: What does he emphasise that he learned form his childhood? (2 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for questions 1.1. and 1.2.

options.text: The moral values of the church
An appreciation for education
That circumstances decide our lives

choices.text: Where did Tom Bentley meet Kylie? (2 p.)

options.text: While doing social work
At a political meeting
Through a mutual friend and workmate

choices.text: Why did he then go out to Australia? (2 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for questions 1.3. and 1.4.

options.text: He wanted to experience a different climate and landscape
He felt life should be thought-provoking rather than conventional
His wife wanted to return to Australia

choices.text: What has Tom Bentley noticed about Australia? (2 p.)

options.text: It doesn’t have as much class structure as the UK
People are satisfied with their lot
Australians value the outdoors more than the British do

choices.text: Why do Australians feel the rest of the world can get lost? (2 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for questions 1.5. and 1.6.

options.text: They feel they enjoy such a unique way of life
They somehow feel threatened by the rest of the world
They feel geographically isolated

choices.text: What has Tom Bentley now learnt about New Labour policy? (2 p.)

options.text: It may have overlooked the needs for local leadership
It couldn’t perhaps create real community involvement
It was more concerned with equality than inequality

choices.text: Why did community sector organisers feel overwhelmed? (2 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for questions 1.7. and 1.8.

options.text: Because they couldn’t make themselves heard
Because of the lack of finances for projects
Because of their inexperience with this type of work

choices.text: What was the car wash intended to do? (2 p.)

options.text: Develop a new community model
Provide work for teenagers
Improve the environment of the housing estate

choices.text: Why did the car wash not really get going? (2 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for questions 1.9. and 1.10.

options.text: Because there were bureaucratic breakdowns
Local businesses opposed it
The authorities didn’t approve of the facilities

questions.text: News There are five sections in this part. Each section is a separate piece of news. You will hear each section twice, and then you will have time to answer that section. Then you will go on to the next section. You will write in English. When you have listened to a recording, you will no longer be able to listen to it again. Used buttons become grey.
What was exceptional about the plane and why? (6 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for question 2.1.
Listen to the recording for the second time.

questions.text: How was the postman mistaken and what was really going on? (6 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for question 2.2.
Listen to the recording for the second time.

questions.text: What did Tobias Heinemann do years ago and why did he stop doing it? (6 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for question 2.3.
Listen to the recording for the second time.
Listen to the recording for question 2.4.
Listen to the recording for the second time.

questions.text: Why did navigation fail and where did the pupils end up? (6 p.)

restrictedMedia.text: Listen to the recording for question 2.5.
Listen to the recording for the second time.

questions.text: Video Please read the instructions and questions before playing the video. The video may itself also contain instructions for answering. You may watch the video as many times as you like. The video can also be paused, fast forwarded and rewound. You will find the video from the materials tab
Mention four different kinds of main points about Jani Leinonen and his present project in your own words. (4 p.)
What, according to Karri Miettinen, is the reason for the worst things that have happened in the history of mankind? (1 p.)
What does Karri Miettinen want to teach in his classes?  (2 p.)
What two main points are stated about the program opening in Kiasma on September 9th? (2 p.)

The test is composed of two parts from previous advanced course English listening comprehension  tests (Fall 2009, Fall 2008), and one video part. The video is edited from Yle’s (Finnish Broadcasting Company) material. Redistribution of the material is prohibited.
